Text: NonPrivilegedpst Gerald Attached are my thoughts on the Bridgeline Texaco issues Well meet at am in EB gdw

FW Nville ParametersNonPrivilegedpst Gerald FYI gdw Original Message From Wilson Garry D Sent Monday August AM To Morgan Robert D Cc Owen David Subject FW Nville Parameters Robert Attached are Harrys calculated volumes for the Napoleonville Storage well The degree temperature is the equilibrium temperature of the salt and was obtained from the temperature log conducted after the drilling of the well gdw Original Message From Allison Harry ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESAllisonCHarryCAllisonpbworldEcomE NRONcom Sent Monday August AM To Wilson Garry D Cc Owen David Tom Hogue Email Subject RE Nville Parameters Garry The following information is in response to Mr Morgans questions please froward to Robert after your review and agreement Cavern Volume BBLs Min WH Pressure psig based on psift gradient the casing shoe Max WH Pressure psig based on psift gradient the casing shoe This pressure will be exceeded at the very end of dewatering to push the brine back to surface it is calculated that the pressure to finish dewatering will be psig w psig of brine system back pressure Pad BaseGas BCF deg F Working Gas BCF deg F Total Gas BCF deg F The well diagram can be found in the Permit Application in Section Thanks Harry Original Message From Morgan Robert D mailtoRobertD NRONcom Sent Monday July PM To Allison Harry Subject Nville Parameters Please start the dewatering process on July th To prepare from my end I need some information Large table showing dewatering progress by day Curve showing max gas injections vs day Cavern parameters Spacial Volume in barrels Min wellhead pressure gradient Max wellhead pressure gradient Pad gas Bcf at what temperature Working Gas Bcf at what temperature Well diagram showing tubulars and diadepth of hanging string I would like these Tuesday pm so I can share them with others before I leave for vacation Thanks
